issue.title: Fix #2111: support pickle for built-in dataclasses

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution! -->
<!-- Unless your change is trivial, please create an issue to discuss the change before creating a PR -->
<!-- See https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/contributing/ for help on Contributing -->

## Change Summary

<!-- Please give a short summary of the changes. -->

When built-in `dataclasses.dataclass` is detected and `pydantic.dataclasses.dataclass` is dynamically created for it, we should register it on module level with unique name to allow pickle work with it. Specific name (`_Pydantic...`) insures that there're no name collisions.

Note: I've also tried another approach to manually handle pickle, by defining `__reduce__` for dynamically created class. `__reduce__` can be used to avoid register newly created class in globals(), by specifying how instance is pickled: one of the parameters can be function, that will recreate this class when needed (e.g. on `pickle.loads`) and create its instance. This works perfectly for simple cases, but here, `config` parameter is also a dynamically created class (fails to be pickled) so, the already complex problem only become bigger.

‚ÑπÔ∏è Regression introduced by #1817 in v1.7.0

## Related issue number

<!-- Are there any issues opened that will be resolved by merging this change? -->
closes https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/2111

## Checklist

* [x] Unit tests for the changes exist
* [x] Tests pass on CI and coverage remains at 100%
* [x] Documentation reflects the changes where applicable
* [x] `changes/<pull request or issue id>-<github username>.md` file added describing change
  (see [changes/README.md](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/master/changes/README.md) for details)

issue.title: v1.7.3

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
@samuelcolvin To help us track them all, here are the fixes that should/could be in a v1.7.3

- [x] fix: ignore `__doc__` as valid private attribute #2091
- [x] Fixes a regression where Enum fields would not propagate keyword arguments to the schema #2109
- [x] fix: update all modified field values in `root_validator` when `validate_assignment` is on #2119
- [x] fix: support `underscore_attrs_are_private` with generic models #2139 
- [x] fix: set right default value for required (optional) fields #2143
- [x] Fix #2111: support pickle for built-in dataclasses #2114

issue.title: dataclass conversion breaks multiprocessing pickling

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
### Checks

* [x] I added a descriptive title to this issue
* [x] I have searched (google, github) for similar issues and couldn't find anything
* [x] I have read and followed [the docs](https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/) and still think this is a bug

# Bug

Output of `python -c "import pydantic.utils; print(pydantic.utils.version_info())"`:
```
python -c "import pydantic.utils; print(pydantic.utils.version_info())"
             pydantic version: 1.8.2
            pydantic compiled: True
                 install path: /home/kazesberger/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/pydantic-pickling-uaEvjRfL-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pydantic
               python version: 3.8.10 (default, Sep 28 2021, 16:10:42)  [GCC 9.3.0]
                     platform: Linux-5.11.0-38-generic-x86_64-with-glibc2.29
     optional deps. installed: ['typing-extensions']

```

```py
import dataclasses
import multiprocessing

import pydantic


@dataclasses.dataclass()   # using pydantic.dataclasses.dataclass() works
class Foo:
    bar: int


class SomeModel(pydantic.BaseModel):
    baaz: int
    foo: Foo


def do_it(q: multiprocessing.Queue):
    model = q.get()
    print(model)

def main():
    multiprocessing.set_start_method(method="spawn")
    q = multiprocessing.Queue()
    p = multiprocessing.Process(target=do_it, args=(q,))
    p.start()
    model = SomeModel(baaz=0, foo=Foo(bar=42))
    q.put(model)
    q.put(None)
    p.join()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

```

```console
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/queues.py", line 116, in get
    return _ForkingPickler.loads(res)
AttributeError: Can't get attribute '_Pydantic_Foo_41343024' on <module 'pydantic.dataclasses' from '/home/kazesberger/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/pydantic-pickling-uaEvjRfL-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pydantic/dataclasses.cpython-38-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>
```

issue.title: üêû Deserializing SubmittedBallot makes ElgamalCiphertext comparison fail

milestone.title: üî• ü¶ñ  Bowser v1.4.0
milestone.description: Math and Performance improvements and refactors.

repository.name: electionguard-python
repository.description: A python module implementing the ElectionGuard specification. This implementation can be used to conduct End-to-End Verifiable Elections as well as privacy-enhanced risk-limiting audits.

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

Since the new serialization has been merged, deserialization fails to reconstruct `SubmittedBallot`s

I'm trying to write the `SubmittedBallot`s to file. In order to create the tally, I deserialize the ballots with the `electionguard.serializer:from_file` function.
By doing this, the `ElgamalCiphertext` aka `ciphertext_accumulation` becomes different from the result of `elgamal_accumulate` function thus result in an invalid ballot that does not become part of the tally.

the `ciphertext_accumulation` is of type `__Pydantic_xxxxxxxx_ElgamalCiphertext` and there's no `__eq__` that can handle this by default.

I see there are some `__eq__` functions defined in electionguard-python and they are all like:
```python
def __eq__(self, other):
    return (
        isinstance(other, type)
        and self.x == other.x
        and self.y == other.y
        ...
    )
```

which is the default `__eq__` function that pydantic generates for `dataclasses`

I suggest that all `dataclasses.dataclass` could be replaced by `pydantic.dataclasses.dataclass`

Pydantic handles the builtins `dataclass.field` with the same syntax and that would allow a working deserializing and generate the `__eq__` function so we could remove them.


If not, we can add only the `__eq__` function for the `ElgamalCiphertext` class, that would help in my own case but I'm not sure that it would be very nice to help such a specific use case.

What could I, in my case, if case dataclasses are not replaced, to deserialize my ballots except by recursively deserializing every class involved in such a ballot ?
What would be the point in being able to serialize every single object in electionguard if deserialization don't work as one could expect?

That's why I think electionguard should use pydantic from start to end, not partly.


### Expected Behavior

_No response_

### Steps To Reproduce

use the `electionguard.serialize:to_file` to write a `SubmittedBallot`
use the `electionguard.serialize:from_file` to load a `SubmittedBallot`

compare the ballot's `ciphertext_accumulation` with the result of its `elgamal_accumulate()` method

### Environment

```markdown
- OS:
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
